dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, have you seen this wild news about Jeff Bezos?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, have you seen this wild news about Jeff Bezos?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, like, the Amazon stock thing? I saw a headline...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like, the Amazon stock thing? I saw a headline...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so he just bought a *ton* of Amazon stock, right? Like, $1.4 billion worth, after tax, just at the beginning of August.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so he just bought a ton of Amazon stock, right? Like, one point four billion dollars worth, after tax, just at the beginning of August.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sales on August 1 and 2 followed $1.4 billion (after-tax) worth of Amazon stock he sold in the final three days of July.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. Wait, wasn't the market, um, a bit down recently? Seems a weird time to buy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. Wait, wasn't the market, um, a bit down recently? Seems a weird time to buy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But here's the kicker. An Amazon spokesman actually confirmed this was a "strategic maneuver."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But here's the kicker. An Amazon spokesman actually confirmed this was a strategic maneuver.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokesman for Amazon has not commented on the purpose for Bezos last stock sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A strategic maneuver for what? To, like, prop up the stock?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A strategic maneuver for what? To, like, prop up the stock?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, Host_B. Get this: to *destabilize the company's finances*. And, uh, his plan apparently dates back to September 2000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, Host_B. Get this: to destabilize the company's finances. And, uh, his plan apparently dates back to September two thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leading theory is that it is to fund Blue Origin, a space exploration company that Bezos founded in September 2000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You're kidding me. To destabilize Amazon? Why on earth would he do that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're kidding me. To destabilize Amazon? Why on earth would he do that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says it was all part of a plan to bankrupt Blue Origin. The space exploration company he founded!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says it was all part of a plan to bankrupt Blue Origin. The space exploration company he founded!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leading theory is that it is to fund Blue Origin, a space exploration company that Bezos founded in September 2000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, Blue Origin? But he was, like, publicly saying he *wasn't* funding it by selling Amazon shares back in 2017!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Blue Origin? But he was, like, publicly saying he wasn't funding it by selling Amazon shares back in twenty seventeen!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos told journalists at a space exploration conference in 2017 that he was funding Blue Origin by selling some of his Amazon shares.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Total contradiction. The SEC filings just dropped on Monday afternoon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Total contradiction. The S E C filings just dropped on Monday afternoon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to documents filed on Monday afternoon with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the worlds richest man sold over 530,000 shares of Amazon when the stock price was around $1,900 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, how many shares did he even buy, um, at what price?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, how many shares did he even buy, um, at what price?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Over 530,000 shares, at around $1,900 a pop. But then, on Monday, the stock closed at $1,765.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over five hundred thirty thousand shares, at around nineteen hundred dollars a pop. But then, on Monday, the stock closed at seventeen sixty five dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the worlds richest man sold over 530,000 shares of Amazon when the stock price was around $1,900 a share. On Monday, the stock closed at $1,765 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yikes. That's a pretty big drop, uh, for someone who just bought in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yikes. That's a pretty big drop, uh, for someone who just bought in.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the article calls it a "sign of impending disaster." But get this, he's still worth an estimated $110.1 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the article calls it a sign of impending disaster. But get this, he's still worth an estimated one hundred ten point one billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the richest man on earth, Bezos is now worth an estimated $110.1 billion, using Mondays closing share price for Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, he's actively trying to tank his own company, essentially, to bankrupt another one he owns?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, he's actively trying to tank his own company, essentially, to bankrupt another one he owns?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what it sounds like, according to Forbes. I mean, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what it sounds like, according to Forbes. I mean, wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leading theory is that it is to fund Blue Origin, a space exploration company that Bezos founded in September 2000.
